From compact one-person models to spacious family-size saunas, our indoor saunas use minimalist design, natural materials and advanced heating technology to create a peaceful, healthy space in your home.

Shop Now

settings.heading: What You Need to Know About Outexer Indoor Saunas

settings.text:
A wellness space that belongs indoors

Outexer indoor saunas are designed for personal retreat and daily life. Whether you want to relax after get off work or start your morning with a clear mind, our saunas create a dedicated space for you to enjoy heat therapy, relax and clear your mind at home anytime, anywhere.
From compact single-person models to family-sized models, each sauna is carefully designed to fit into the bedroom, gym or wellness room without sacrificing design and functionality.


Built for Comfort, crafted with craftsmanship

We use natural woods such as Canadian hemlock, okoume and cedar, which are known for their good stability, strong thermal insulation and elegant grain. The interior dimensions are carefully optimized to provide ample seating space and a calm atmosphere, while the exterior lines reflect a modern and simple style that complements any interior decoration.
Tempered glass doors, smooth surfaces and precision seams create a clean, safe and luxurious texture. Make every use of Outexer relaxing, rejuvenating and enjoyable.

Why Outexer?

Space-saving design: Our indoor saunas are available in a variety of sizes to suit different room layouts, from city apartments to home gyms.
Quiet warmth: Equipped with an optimized heating system, noise and vibration are minimized for a more peaceful experience.
Easy installation: The modular structure and clear instructions make installation simple - even in tight indoor corners.
Safe materials: All wood finishes are low-VOC and non-toxic, ensuring clean air with every use.
Easy maintenance: The smooth panels and durable electronics make daily cleaning and care quick and easy.


Benefits of using an indoor sauna

  • Helps relax the nervous system and relieve daily stress
  • Helps improve sleep and improve mental clarity
  • Warms muscles before exercise and aids recovery after exercise
  • Promotes healthy blood circulation and makes skin glow
  • Improve your overall self-care experience without leaving home

From compact one-person models to spacious family-size saunas, our indoor saunas use minimalist design,
natural materials and advanced heating technology to create a peaceful, healthy space in your home.

settings.heading: How to Choose the Right Indoor Sauna for Your Home?
settings.text:
Not sure which indoor sauna is right for your space and lifestyle? Here’s a quick guide to help you out:

  • Estimate Your Space: Start by measuring your available square footage. Our compact single-person saunas fit easily into a bedroom, home gym, or corner, while double saunas require a larger room or basement.
  • Check Power Requirements: All Outexer indoor saunas are designed to plug into a standard US outlet (120V, 15A or 20A) for easy installation without the need for additional wiring.
  • Consider Features: Want a Bluetooth speaker? Mood lighting? Negative ionizer? Decide which features will enhance your daily routine and enrich your sauna experience.
  • Quiet Operation: Outexer saunas are designed for quiet use, so you can enjoy a peaceful and healthy time without disturbing others, even in shared spaces or small living spaces.
  • Focus on beauty: Our saunas have a stylish design and natural wood finishes that blend in perfectly with modern, minimalist or cozy interiors. There is always one that suits your style.

Still unsure? Contact us at any time and we will be happy to find the best option for you.

settings.title: Hear from Real Outexer Customers
settings.sub_title: Real feedback from happy sauna owners

settings.custom_liquid:
Outexer Indoor Sauna FAQs

How much space do I need to install an indoor sauna?
Most of our indoor models are compact enough to fit into a bedroom, home gym, or spare room. There are compact single-person models and multi-person models for 2-4 people, please refer to the size chart of each product for details.
Is the indoor sauna easy to assemble?
Yes. All Outexer saunas are modular in design with labeled panels and step-by-step instructions. Most users can complete the installation in less than an hour using basic tools, without complicated processes and tools.
Does the indoor sauna require a dedicated electrical outlet?
It depends on the model. Single-person models can basically use a standard 120V, 15A household outlet (NEMA 5-15P). Two-person and larger or high-power models may require a 20A outlet. Be sure to check the "Electrical Parameters" section of the product page before ordering.
Is the indoor sauna noisy when in operation?
Not at all. Our heating system operates quietly, with no fans or mechanical hum. If equipped with a Bluetooth speaker or oxygen bar, it also produces minimal ambient noise. You can easily enjoy music, meditation, or even pure silence.
Can the indoor sauna be placed on any type of floor?
Yes. Outexer saunas can be placed on hardwood floors, tiles, concrete, and even low-pile carpets. Just make sure the floor is flat and dry. For additional insulation or moisture protection, you can choose to use a protective mat (optional).
How much clearance do I need around my sauna?
We recommend leaving at least 2" of space between the sauna and surrounding walls. This is especially true near ventilation or wiring areas. If necessary, you can move the sides of the sauna closer to the wall, but avoid completely enclosing it to ensure good air circulation.

settings.heading: 1. How much space do I need to install an indoor sauna?
settings.row_content: Most of our indoor models are compact enough to fit into a bedroom, home gym, or spare room. There are compact single-person models and multi-person models for 2-4 people, please refer to the size chart of each product for details.

settings.heading: 2. Is the indoor sauna easy to assemble?
settings.row_content: Yes. All Outexer saunas are modular in design with labeled panels and step-by-step instructions. Most users can complete the installation in less than an hour using basic tools, without complicated processes and tools.

settings.heading: 3. Does the indoor sauna require a dedicated electrical outlet?
settings.row_content: It depends on the model. Single-person models can basically use a standard 120V, 15A household outlet (NEMA 5-15P). Two-person and larger or high-power models may require a 20A outlet. Be sure to check the "Electrical Parameters" section of the product page before ordering.

settings.heading: 4. Is the indoor sauna noisy when in operation?
settings.row_content: Not at all. Our heating system operates quietly, with no fans or mechanical hum. If equipped with a Bluetooth speaker or oxygen bar, it also produces minimal ambient noise. You can easily enjoy music, meditation, or even pure silence.

settings.heading: 5. Can the indoor sauna be placed on any type of floor?
settings.row_content: Yes. Outexer saunas can be placed on hardwood floors, tiles, concrete, and even low-pile carpets. Just make sure the floor is flat and dry. For additional insulation or moisture protection, you can choose to use a protective mat (optional).

settings.heading: 6. How much clearance do I need around my sauna?
settings.row_content: We recommend leaving at least 2" of space between the sauna and surrounding walls. This is especially true near ventilation or wiring areas. If necessary, you can move the sides of the sauna closer to the wall, but avoid completely enclosing it to ensure good air circulation.

settings.heading: 7. Do I need to ventilate my sauna?
settings.row_content: Most Outexer saunas have ventilation and electrical components located at the top, so it is important to keep the top of the sauna open to allow heat and air circulation. You do not need to install a separate ventilation system, just make sure the top area is not blocked and has enough space for ventilation.
